name: Plot

types.name: Element
types.comment: Represents a child element of the plot.

values.name: area
values.type: List (Plot.Area.Attribute msg) -> List Plot.Point -> Plot.Element msg

values.name: bars
values.comment: This wraps all your bar series.
values.type: List (Plot.Bars.Attribute msg) -> List (List (Plot.Bars.StyleAttribute msg)) -> List Plot.Bars.Data -> Plot.Element msg

values.name: classes
values.comment: Adds classes to the svg element.

values.name: custom
values.comment:
This element is passed a function which can translate your values into
 svg coordinates. This way you can build your own serie types. Although
 if you feel like you're missing something let me know!

values.name: domainHighest
values.comment:
Alter the domain's upper boundary. The function provided will
 be passed the lowest y-value present in any of your series and the result will
 be the upper boundary of your series. So if you would like
 the lowest boundary to  always be 10, then set this attribute to the function `always 10`.

 The default is `identity`.

 **Note:** If you are using `padding` as well, the extra padding will still be
 added outside the domain.

values.name: domainLowest
values.comment:
Alter the domain's lower boundary. The function provided will
 be passed the lowest y-value present in any of your series and the result will
 be the lower boundary of your series. So if you would like
 the lowest boundary to simply be the edge of your series, then set
 this attribute to the function `identity`.
 If you want it to always be -5, then set this attribute to the function `always -5`.

 The default is `identity`.

 **Note:** If you are using `padding` as well, the extra padding will still be
 added outside the domain.

values.name: getHoveredValue
values.comment: Get the hovered position from state.

values.name: hint
values.comment:
Adds a hint to your plot. See [this example](https://github.com/terezka/elm-plot/blob/master/examples/Interactive.elm)

 Remember to use `plotInteractive` for the events to be processed!.
values.type: List (Plot.Hint.Attribute msg) -> Maybe.Maybe Plot.Point -> Plot.Element msg

values.name: id
values.comment: Adds an id to the svg element.

values.name: line
values.type: List (Plot.Line.Attribute msg) -> List Plot.Point -> Plot.Element msg

values.name: margin
values.comment:
Specify margin around the plot. Useful when your ticks are outside the
 plot and you would like to add space to see them! Values are in pixels and
the format is `( top, right, bottom, left )`.

 Default: `( 0, 0, 0, 0 )`

values.name: padding
values.comment:
Adds padding to your plot, meaning extra space below
 and above the lowest and highest point in your plot.
 The unit is pixels and the format is `( bottom, top )`.

 Default: `( 0, 0 )`

values.name: plot
values.comment:
This is the function processing your entire plot configuration.
 Pass your attributes and elements to this function and
 a svg plot will be returned!
values.type: List Plot.Attribute -> List (Plot.Element msg) -> Svg.Svg msg

values.name: plotInteractive
values.comment:
So this is like `plot`, except the message to is `Interaction msg`. It's a message wrapping
 your message, so you can use the build in interactions (like the hint!) in the plot as well as adding your own.
 See [this example](https://github.com/terezka/elm-plot/blob/master/examples/Interactive.elm).
values.type: List Plot.Attribute -> List (Plot.Element (Plot.Interaction msg)) -> Svg.Svg (Plot.Interaction msg)

values.name: rangeHighest
values.comment:
Provide a function to determine the upper boundary of range.
 See `domainHighest` and imagine we're talking about the x-axis.

values.name: rangeLowest
values.comment:
Provide a function to determine the lower boundary of range.
 See `domainLowest` and imagine we're talking about the x-axis.

values.name: scatter
values.type: List (Plot.Scatter.Attribute msg) -> List Plot.Point -> Plot.Element msg

values.name: size
values.comment:
Specify the size of your plot in pixels and in the format
 of `( width, height )`.

 Default: `( 800, 500 )`

values.name: style
values.comment: Adds styles to the svg element.

name: Plot.Axis

values.name: anchorInside
values.comment:
Anchor the ticks/labels on the inside of the plot. By default they are anchored on the outside.

    myXAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myXAxis =
        Plot.xAxis
            [ Axis.view
                [ Axis.anchorInside ]
            ]

values.name: classes
values.comment:
Adds classes to the container holding your axis.

    myXAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myXAxis =
        Plot.xAxis
            [ Axis.view
                [ Axis.classes [ "axis--x" ] ]
            ]

values.name: cleanCrossings
values.comment:
Remove tick and value where the axis crosses the opposite axis.

    myXAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myXAxis =
        Plot.xAxis
            [ Axis.view [ Axis.cleanCrossings ] ]

values.name: label
values.comment:
By providing this attribute with a list of [label attributes](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/terezka/elm-plot/latest/Plot-Label),
 you may alter the values and ticks displayed as your axis' labels.

    myYAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myYAxis =
        Plot.yAxis
            [ Axis.label
                [ Label.view
                    [ Label.displace (10, 0)
                    , Label.stroke "blue"
                    ]
                , Label.format (.value >> toString)
                ]
            ]

values.name: labelValues
values.comment:
Specify the values which you want a label for. If not specified, it will mirror
  the tick values.

    myYAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myYAxis =
        Plot.yAxis
            [ Axis.labelValues [ 0, 5, 10, 11 ] ]

values.name: line
values.comment:
Adds styles to the axis line.

    myXAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myXAxis =
        Plot.xAxis
            [ Axis.view
                [ Axis.line [ Line.stroke "blue" ] ]
            ]

values.name: positionHighest
values.comment:
Position this axis to the highest value on the opposite axis. E.g. if
 this attribute is added on an y-axis, it will be positioned to the right.

    myXAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myXAxis =
        Plot.xAxis
            [ Axis.view
                [ Axis.positionHighest ]
            ]

values.name: positionLowest
values.comment:
Position this axis to the lowest value on the opposite axis. E.g. if
 this attribute is added on an y-axis, it will be positioned to the left.

    myXAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myXAxis =
        Plot.xAxis
            [ Axis.view
                [ Axis.positionLowest ]
            ]

values.name: tick
values.comment:
By providing this attribute with a list of [tick attributes](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/terezka/elm-plot/latest/Plot-Tick),
 you may alter the values and ticks displayed as your axis' ticks.

    myYAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myYAxis =
        Plot.yAxis
            [ Axis.tick
                [ Tick.view [ Tick.length 3 ] ]
            , Axis.tickValues [ 2, 4, 6 ]
            ]

values.name: tickDelta
values.comment:
Specify what values will be added a tick by specifying the space between each tick.

    myXAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myXAxis =
        Plot.xAxis
            [ Axis.tickDelta 4 ]

 **Note:** If you add another attribute altering the values like `tickValues` _after_ this attribute,
 then this attribute will have no effect.

values.name: tickValues
values.comment:
Specify at what values will be added a tick.

    myXAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myXAxis =
        Plot.xAxis
            [ Axis.tickValues [ 0, 1, 2, 4, 8 ] ]

 **Note:** If you add another attribute altering the values like `tickDelta` _after_ this attribute,
 then this attribute will have no effect.

name: Plot.Bars

aliases.name: Data
aliases.comment: The data format the bars element requires.

aliases.name: DataTransformers
aliases.comment:
The functions necessary to transform your data into the format the plot requires.
 If you provide the `xValue` with `Nothing`, the bars xValues will just be the index
 of the bar in the list.
aliases.type: { yValues : data -> List Internal.Types.Value , xValue : Maybe.Maybe (data -> Internal.Types.Value) }

aliases.name: LabelInfo
aliases.comment: The info your label format option will be passed.
aliases.type: { index : Int , xValue : Internal.Types.Value , yValue : Internal.Types.Value }

values.name: customAttrs
values.comment: Add your own attributes. For events, see [this example](https://github.com/terezka/elm-plot/blob/master/examples/Interactive.elm)

values.name: fill
values.comment: Set the fill color.

values.name: label
values.comment:
Alter the view of your label.

    myBarSeries : Plot.Element msg
    myBarSeries =
      bars
          [ Bars.label
              [ Label.classes [ "label-class" ]
              , Label.displace ( 12, 0 )
              ]
          ]
          barStyles
          data

values.name: maxBarWidth
values.comment: Set a fixed max width (in pixels) on your bars.

values.name: maxBarWidthPer
values.comment: Set a relative max width (in percentage) your bars.

values.name: opacity
values.comment: Set the opacity.

values.name: stackByY
values.comment: By default your bars are stacked by x. If you want to stack them y, add this attribute.

values.name: toBarData
values.type: Plot.Bars.DataTransformers data -> List data -> List Plot.Bars.Data

name: Plot.Grid
comment:
Attributes for altering the view of your grid.

    myGrid : Plot.Element (Interaction YourMsg)
    myGrid =
        line
            [ stroke "deeppink"
            , strokeWidth 2
            , opacity 0.5
            , customAttrs
                [ Svg.Events.onClick <| Custom MyClickMsg
                , Svg.Events.onMouseOver <| Custom Glow
                ]
            ]
            areaDataPoints

# Definition
@docs Attribute

# Styling
@docs lines, classes

# Values
@docs values

# Others
@docs customAttrs

values.name: classes
values.comment:
Adds classes to the grid container.

    myGrid : Plot.Element msg
    myGrid =
        verticalGrid [ Grid.classes [ "my-grid" ] ]

values.name: customAttrs
values.comment: Add your own attributes to your gridlines. For events, see [this example](https://github.com/terezka/elm-plot/blob/master/examples/Interactive.elm)

values.name: lines
values.comment: Configure the view of the grid lines.

values.name: values
values.comment:
Specify a list of ticks where you want grid lines drawn.

    myGrid : Plot.Element msg
    myGrid =
        verticalGrid [ Grid.values [ 2, 4, 6 ] ]

 If values are not specified with this attribute, the grid will mirror the ticks.

name: Plot.Area
comment:
Attributes for altering the view of your area serie.

    myAreaSerie : Plot.Element (Interaction YourMsg)
    myAreaSerie =
        line
            [ stroke "deeppink"
            , strokeWidth 2
            , fill "red"
            , opacity 0.5
            , customAttrs
                [ Svg.Events.onClick <| Custom MyClickMsg
                , Svg.Events.onMouseOver <| Custom Glow
                ]
            ]
            areaDataPoints

values.name: opacity
values.comment: Set the opacity.

name: Plot.Tick
comment:
Attributes for altering the view of your axis' ticks.

 Before you read any further, please note that when I speak of the tick _index_,
 then I'm talking about how many ticks that particular tick is from the origin.

 Ok, now you can go on!

# Definition
@docs Attribute

# View options
@docs view, viewDynamic, viewCustom

## Style attributes
If these attributes do not fulfill your needs, try out the `viewCustom`! If you have
a suspicion that I have missed a very common configuration, then please let me know and I'll add it.

@docs StyleAttribute, classes, width, length, stroke, strokeWidth, opacity, customAttrs

aliases.name: Attribute
aliases.type: Internal.Tick.Config a msg -> Internal.Tick.Config a msg

values.name: classes
values.comment:
Add classes to the tick.

    myYAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myYAxis =
        Plot.yAxis
            [ Axis.tick
                [ Tick.view
                    [ Tick.classes [ "my-tick" ] ]
                ]
            ]

values.name: customAttrs
values.comment: Add your own attributes. For events, see [this example](https://github.com/terezka/elm-plot/blob/master/examples/Interactive.elm)

values.name: length
values.comment:
Set the length of the tick (in pixels).

    myYAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myYAxis =
        Plot.yAxis
            [ Axis.tick
                [ Tick.view
                    [ Tick.length 8 ]
                ]
            ]

values.name: opacity
values.comment: Set the opacity.

values.name: stroke
values.comment: Set the stroke color.

values.name: strokeWidth
values.comment: Set the stroke width (in pixels).

values.name: view
values.comment:
Provide a list of style attributes to alter the view of the tick.

    myYAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myYAxis =
        Plot.yAxis
            [ Axis.tick
                [ Tick.view
                    [ Tick.stroke "deeppink"
                    , Tick.length 5
                    , Tick.width 2
                    ]
                ]
            ]

 **Note:** If you add another attribute altering the view like `viewDynamic` or `viewCustom` _after_ this attribute,
 then this attribute will have no effect.

values.name: viewCustom
values.comment:
Define your own view for the labels. Your view will be passed label's value and index (amount of ticks from origin).

    viewTick : ( Int, Float ) -> Svg.Svg a
    viewTick ( index, tick ) =
        text_
            [ transform "translate(-5, 10)"
            , Svg.Events.onClick (Custom MyTickClickMsg)
            ]
            [ tspan
                []
                [ text (if isOdd index then "ðŸŒŸ" else "â­") ]
            ]

    myXAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myXAxis =
        Plot.xAxis
            [ Axis.tick
                [ Tick.viewCustom viewTick ]
            ]

 **Note:** If you add another attribute altering the view like `view` or `viewDynamic` _after_ this attribute,
 then this attribute will have no effect.

values.name: viewDynamic
values.comment:
Alter the view of the tick based on the tick's value and index (amount of ticks from origin) by
 providing a function returning a list of style attributes.

    toTickStyles : ( Int, Float ) -> List Tick.StyleAttribute
    toTickStyles ( index, value ) =
        if isOdd index then
            [ Tick.length 7
            , Tick.stroke , "#e4e3e3"
            ]
        else
            [ Tick.length 10
            , Tick.stroke "#b9b9b9"
            ]

    myYAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myYAxis =
        Plot.yAxis
            [ Axis.tick
                [ Tick.viewDynamic toTickStyles ]
            ]

 **Note:** If you add another attribute altering the view like `view` or `viewCustom` _after_ this attribute,
 then this attribute will have no effect.

values.name: width
values.comment:
Set the width of the tick (in pixels).

    myYAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myYAxis =
        Plot.yAxis
            [ Axis.tick
                [ Tick.view
                    [ Tick.width 2 ]
                ]
            ]

name: Plot.Scatter
comment:
Attributes for altering the view of your scatter serie.

    myScatterSerie : Plot.Element (Interaction YourMsg)
    myScatterSerie =
        line
            [ stroke "deeppink"
            , strokeWidth 2
            , fill "purple"
            , opacity 0.5
            , radius 10
            , customAttrs
                [ Svg.Events.onClick <| Custom MyClickMsg
                , Svg.Events.onMouseOver <| Custom Glow
                ]
            ]
            scatterDataPoints

values.name: opacity
values.comment: Set the opacity.

values.name: radius
values.comment: Set the radius of your points.

values.name: stroke
values.comment: Set the stroke color.

values.name: strokeWidth

name: Plot.Label
comment:
Attributes for altering the view of your labels.

 Before you read any further, please note that when I speak of the label _index_,
 then I'm talking about how many labels that particular label is from the origin.

 Ok, now you can go on!

# Definition
@docs Attribute

# View options
@docs view, viewDynamic, viewCustom

## Style attributes
If these attributes do not fulfill your needs, try out the viewCustom! If you have
a suspicion that I have missed a very common configuration, then please let me know and I'll add it.
@docs StyleAttribute, classes, displace, stroke, strokeWidth, opacity, fill, fontSize, customAttrs

# Value formatting
@docs format, formatFromList

aliases.name: Attribute
aliases.type: Internal.Label.Config a msg -> Internal.Label.Config a msg

values.name: classes
values.comment:
Adds classes to the label.

    myYAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myYAxis =
        Plot.yAxis
            [ Axis.label
                [ Label.view
                    [ Label.classes [ "my-class" ] ]
                ]
            ]

values.name: customAttrs
values.comment: Add your own attributes. For events, see [this example](https://github.com/terezka/elm-plot/blob/master/examples/Interactive.elm)

values.name: displace
values.comment:
Displaces the label.

    myYAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myYAxis =
        Plot.yAxis
            [ Axis.label
                [ Label.view
                    [ Label.displace ( 12, 0 ) ]
                ]
            ]

values.name: fill
values.comment: Set the fill color.

values.name: fontSize
values.comment: Set the font size (in pixels).

values.name: format
values.comment:
Format the label based on its value and index.

    formatter : Int -> Float -> String
    formatter index value =
        if isDivisibleBy5 index then
            formatEveryFifth value
        else
            normalFormat value

    myYAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myYAxis =
        Plot.yAxis
            [ Axis.label
                [ Label.format formatter ]
            ]

values.name: opacity
values.comment: Set the opacity.

values.name: stroke
values.comment: Set the stroke color.

values.name: strokeWidth
values.comment: Set the stroke width (in pixels).

values.name: view
values.comment:
Provide a list of style attributes to alter the view of the label.

    myYAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myYAxis =
        Plot.yAxis
            [ Axis.label
                [ Label.view
                    [ Label.classes [ "label-class" ]
                    , Label.displace ( 12, 0 )
                    ]
                ]
            ]

 **Note:** If you add another attribute altering the view like `viewDynamic` or `viewCustom` _after_ this attribute,
 then this attribute will have no effect.

values.name: viewCustom
values.comment:
Define your own view for the labels. Your view will be passed label's value and index (amount of ticks from origin).

    viewLabel : Int -> Float -> Svg.Svg a
    viewLabel index value =
        let
            attrs =
                if isOdd index then oddAttrs else evenAttrs
        in
            text_ attrs (toString value)

    myYAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myYAxis =
        Plot.yAxis
            [ Axis.label
                [ Label.viewCustom viewLabel ]
            ]

 **Note:** If you add another attribute altering the view like `view` or `viewDynamic` _after_ this attribute,
 then this attribute will have no effect.

values.name: viewDynamic
values.comment:
Alter the view of the label based on the label's value and index (amount of ticks from origin) by
 providing a function returning a list of style attributes.

    toViewStyles : Int -> Float -> List Label.StyleAttribute a
    toViewStyles index value =
        if isOdd index then
            [ Label.classes [ "label--odd" ]
            , Label.displace ( 12, 0 )
            ]
        else
            [ Label.classes [ "label--even" ]
            , Label.displace ( 16, 0 )
            ]

    myYAxis : Plot.Element msg
    myYAxis =
        Plot.yAxis
            [ Axis.label
                [ Label.viewDynamic toViewStyles ]
            ]

 **Note:** If you add another attribute altering the view like `view` or `viewCustom` _after_ this attribute,
 then this attribute will have no effect.

name: Plot.Line
comment:
Attributes for altering the view of your line serie.

    myLineSerie : Plot.Element (Interaction YourMsg)
    myLineSerie =
        line
            [ stroke "deeppink"
            , strokeWidth 2
            , opacity 0.5
            , smoothing Cosmetic
            , customAttrs
                [ Svg.Events.onClick <| Custom MyClickMsg ]
            ]
            lineDataPoints

name: Plot.Hint
comment:
Attributes for altering the view of your hint.

 Notice that this element will only be rendered when using `plotInteractive`!

 P.S. You also have to add [elm-plot.css](https://github.com/terezka/elm-plot/tree/master/src/elm-plot.css)
 for it to look nice.

# Definition
@docs Attribute, HintInfo, IsLeftSide

# Styling
@docs viewCustom, lineStyle

aliases.name: HintInfo
aliases.comment: The available info provided to your hint view.

values.name: lineStyle
values.comment: Add styles to the line indicating the hovered value.

values.name: viewCustom
values.comment: Uses your own view to display the hint box.

name: Plot.Types

aliases.name: HintInfo
aliases.comment: The info you from the hint.
